revised_title: Virial Coefficients of the Carbon Dioxide-Ethylene System: Pure Gases
tldr: This study investigates the virial coefficients of the carbon dioxide-ethylene system, focusing on pure gases. The authors determined the coefficients using the series-expansion method and examined various forms of intermolecular potential. They found that a Lennard-Jones 6:12 potential accurately represents the second virial coefficient of ethylene, while a small discrepancy in the representation for carbon dioxide may be rectified by introducing a quadrupole interaction term. The research contributes to understanding the properties of gas mixtures in relation to their pure constituents.
